This message is automatically generated.

> ... the callee does not expect it to be.

Except for tests, BlockInfo.addStorage(..) is only called by DatanodeStorageInfo.addBlock(..).  Do you mean that DatanodeStorageInfo.addBlock(..) is the ONLY callee and the bug is that it does not remove the block from otherStorage's list?

If my understanding is correct, how about we do all the checks in DatanodeStorageInfo.addBlock(..) but not BlockInfo.addStorage(..)?  i.e. DatanodeStorageInfo.addBlock(..) will also check whether otherStorage == this and return false if it is; BlockInfo.addStorage(..) will blindly add storage to the list without any check?

bq. BlockManager.addStorage fails when DN updates storage
You meant BlockInfo.addStorage(..) ?

Arpit. Have you seen this occuring?

Codewise, changes looks good.

but, is this really happening?

IMO, this can happen only if,
1. Block is present in multiple storages of the same datanode. DN will not allow this to happen through write flow.
2. Block is moved manually to some other storage and DN restarted.

bq. Block is moved manually to some other storage
Yes this is indeed how I hit the issue. This should not cause the NN to assert.

Updated patch to perform the check in DatanodeStorageInfo.addBlock().

I see.  Thanks for the clarification.

+1 the new patch looks good.
Thanks for reviewing [~szetszwo] and [~vinayrpet]. Will commit once Jenkins +1s.

Hi Vinayakumar, do you know how to reproduce or verify this issue? I had tested case 2, but it's not working. NN will not delete other unnecessary block
Hi Vinayakumar, do you know how to reproduce or verify this issue? I had tested case 2, but it's not working. NN will not delete other unnecessary block

Hi [~xingfengshen], 
According to case 2, block is not present in multiple storages, but its been moved from one storage ( which NN thinks) to another storage ( which NN need to know).
This Jira is about updating the NN's blocksmap with correct storage for the block.

Datanode itself will not load duplicate replicas into replicas map. It will try to resolve duplicates and retains the latest one during startup.
